solution.text:
Diameter of cricket ball,\(r=\frac1{_{j}_} \times\) diameter of the large sphere,\(R\).
\(\Rightarrow R=_{j}_r\)
Surface area of cricket ball\(=4\pi r^2\)
Surface area of the large sphere\(=4\pi R^2\)
\(=4\pi (_{j}_r)^2\)
\(=_{{4*j**2}}_\pi r^2\)
Ratio of the surface area of the cricket ball to that of the sphere\(=\frac{4\pi r^2}{_{{4*j**2}}_\pi r^2}=\frac1{_{{j**2}}_}\)

content.text: The diameter of a cricket ball is approximately \(\frac1{_{j}_}\) the diameter of a large sphere. Find the ratio of their surface areas.
